title: Chronic pain management for older adults living in the community
abstractText:
The aim of these seminars are to enable the development of ideas that will shape future practice, policy and research agendas in the management of chronic pain in later life. Experienced researchers, novice researchers and service users will meet six times over a period of 2 years. Following a presentation on an aspect of pain there will be small group discussions on issues raised for participants.

Objectives:

  • to develop a fuller understanding of chronic pain management in later life from the perspective of those involved in its management, but centred on the experiences and perspectives of older adults themselves
  • to provide the opportunity for experienced researchers (from universities and health care settings), novice researchers and older adults to learn from each other and to share ideas in relation to chronic pain management in later life
  • to develop a user panel who may be invited to be involved in the development of future research initiatives and proposals
  • to facilitate research and writing collaborations between older adults, the groups that represent them and researchers
  • to encourage the development of new researchers by the presentation and discussion of current and innovative research and collaboration with older adults.
